The **fire horn** and **frost horn** are rare [musical instruments](/wiki/Musical_instrument "Musical instrument") that can deal elemental damage.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Effects](#Effects)
- [3 Identification](#Identification)
- [4 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [5 FIQHack](#FIQHack)
- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Fire and frost horns start with 4 to 8 charges.

## Effects

[Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a fire or frost horn with charges left will prompt you to improvise; if you answer yes, the game will ask the player for a direction, and the horn will emit a [ray](/wiki/Ray "Ray") of fire or cold respectively. This will [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") the horn.

For each application of the horn, a number X is chosen between 6 and 11 inclusive.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Each monster hit with the ray will then be dealt [Xd6](/wiki/D_notation "D notation") damage, unless it [resists](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance") the respective element. (Contrast this with the respective [wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand"), for which the X always equals 6.) Frost horns also deal Xd3 additional damage to monsters resistant to fire but not to cold, and fire horns deal 7 extra damage to monsters resistant to cold but not to fire.

An uncharged fire or frost horn behaves the same as a [tooled horn](/wiki/Tooled_horn "Tooled horn"); answering no to the "Improvise?" prompt also lets you play the horn as a musical instrument without using up any charges.

The horn can be [recharged](/wiki/Recharge "Recharge") an unlimited number of times, but can only hold up to 20 charges at once. Each recharge adds 1d4 charges, or 2d4 if the scroll is blessed.

## Identification

Apply an unidentified horn as soon as you find it. If it produces an item, it's a [horn of plenty](/wiki/Horn_of_plenty "Horn of plenty") and it will be [auto-identified](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") as such. Otherwise, you can choose not to improvise to conserve a charge. [Tooled horns](/wiki/Tooled_horn "Tooled horn") can be eliminated by [price identification](/wiki/Price_identification "Price identification") (they cost only 15 [zm](/wiki/Zm "Zm")); a horn that costs 50 zm and doesn't produce food must be either fire or frost. There's no way to tell the two apart without direct identification or spending a charge.

## Strategy

Fire and frost horns are offensively superior to their [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand") counterparts, dealing about 40% more damage on average. They are also not destroyed by [shock](/wiki/Shock "Shock") attacks. Fire horns cannot be used to engrave [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth"), however. Even after spending all the charges the horn is useful, as it becomes able to [scare](/wiki/Scare "Scare") monsters. Recharging them is generally unwise, as by the time you have ample access to [charging](/wiki/Charging "Charging"), you should also have collected more elemental wands than you could ever use, allowing you to save your charging scrolls for more important purposes. A player that gets the [PYEC](/wiki/PYEC "PYEC") and an elemental horn early may be an exception to this advice, though.

As with all [rays](/wiki/Ray "Ray"), be careful not to aim the horn in the wrong direction and cause a potentially deadly [rebound](/wiki/Rebound "Rebound"), whether you are identifying it or using it against monsters; this also makes it somewhat difficult to use them in tight corridors.

## FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack") fire and frost horns deal ([experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") \* d6) damage. This generally makes these horns less dangerous in the early game.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/music.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 600](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/music.c#L600)
